00025 #ifndef __FrameListener_H__
00026 #define __FrameListener_H__
00027 
00028 
00029 #include "OgrePrerequisites.h"
00030 
00031 namespace Ogre {
00032 
00035     struct FrameEvent
00036     {
00041         Real timeSinceLastEvent;
00045         Real timeSinceLastFrame;
00046     };
00047 
00048 
00067     class _OgreExport FrameListener
00068     {
00069         /*
00070         Note that this could have been an abstract class, but I made
00071         the explicit choice not to do this, because I wanted to give
00072         people the option of only implementing the methods they wanted,
00073         rather than having to create 'do nothing' implementations for
00074         those they weren't interested in. As such this class follows
00075         the 'Adapter' classes in Java rather than pure interfaces.
00076         */
00077     public:
00083         virtual bool frameStarted(const FrameEvent& evt) { return true; }
00089         virtual bool frameEnded(const FrameEvent& evt) { return true; }
00090     };
00091 }
00092 
00093 #endif
